heading: Is Kimchi gluten free?
intro: This public analysis report explains the biggest gluten risks in Kimchi and how to order more safely.

verdict.summary: While traditional kimchi is generally gluten-free, there is a risk of gluten contamination from certain ingredients or cross-contact during preparation. It's important to verify the specific ingredients used.

disclaimer: This guidance is informational only. Always verify ingredients and preparation with the restaurant.

sections.title: Quick answer
sections.body: Kimchi can vary by recipe, ingredients, and cross-contact controls in the kitchen.

sections.title: Common gluten risks
sections.body: Watch for hidden sources like soy sauce, malt flavoring, marinades, thickeners, and shared fryers.

sections.title: How BiteRight helps

waiter_script.preview: Is this kimchi made without any wheat or barley ingredients?

faq.question: Can BiteRight confirm if Kimchi is gluten free?
faq.answer: BiteRight highlights likely gluten risks based on ingredients and preparation. Always confirm with the kitchen if you have coeliac disease.

faq.question: What should I ask a restaurant?
faq.answer: Ask about shared equipment, sauces, marinades, and whether the kitchen has a dedicated gluten-free prep area.
